docstring.long_description:
Compatible with National Instruments devices that utilize NI-DAQmx. The device must have a analog thermocouple input channel.
Tested with a simulated NI-9219 module.

This instrument will likely only be compatible with Windows systems due to
NI driver availablity. To use the instrument you must install the runtime:

https://www.ni.com/en/support/downloads/drivers/download.ni-daq-mx.html
docstring.short_description: Creates a task with (a) channel(s) that use a thermocouple to measure temperature.

parameters.name: cDAQ_start_channel
parameters.description: The device and channel to read from.

parameters.name: cDAQ_end_channel
parameters.description: To read from only one channel, set this to the same as cDAQ_start_channel. To read from multiple channels, set this to the last channel you want to read from.

parameters.name: min_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the minimum value you expect to measure.

parameters.name: max_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the maximum value you expect to measure.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: The units to use to return thermocouple measurements.

parameters.name: cold_junction_source
parameters.description: Optional, specifies the source of cold junction compensation.

parameters.name: cold_junction_value
parameters.description: Optional, specifies the cold junction temperature in **units** if cold_junction_source is set to "Constant".

parameters.name: cold_junction_channel
parameters.description: Optional, specifies the source of cold junction compensation if cold_junction_source is set to "Channel".
